item.title: Designing my Business Card
item.description: For our final homework assignment in Visual Language, we were to design a logo and business card for ourselves. Earlier in the semseter, when I heard that this would be our final project, I was both excited and terrified. This proved to be very challenging in the end. When it finally came time to work on this, I found myself frequently criticizing my designs, starting over, and letting out a highly audible sigh that made those around me chuckle.

item.title: Zoetrope Light and Materials Exploration
item.description: See Part 2 and Part 3 of this project. item.title: Designing for Digital Fabrication - Drawing a Real World Object in Vectorworks
item.description: Our first homework assignment for Daniel Rozin’s Designing for Digital Fabrication class was to draw three 2d perspectives of a real world object in Vectorworks. I took this as an opportunity to get the exact dimensions of an object I’ve been eager to to incorporate into a project. At the Armory show in 2015, I discovered and was amazed by the low-resolution work of Jim Campbell. Jim Campbell - Scattered 25X (Marathon)
